prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.375] Create the first face of the sketch with the following components: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.525] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.525], End Point [0.0, 0.525] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.525], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create the second face of the sketch with the following components: * Circle 1: Center [0.375, 0.2625], Radius 0.15 Each loop is closed, and the first face has two loops. The first loop includes lines 1, 2, 3, and 4, while the second loop includes circle 1. The sketch should appear as a flat top and bottom with a circular hole in the center of the top face. For the extrusion, use the following parameters: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.1875 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 * sketch_scale: 0.75 * operation: Create a new solid body This completes the construction of the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.225, 0.1125, 0.375] Create the sketch with the following components: * Circle 1: Center [0.15, 0.15], Radius 0.15 Each loop is closed, and the sketch includes one loop. The loop includes circle 1. The sketch should appear as a circle. For the extrusion, use the following parameters: * extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 * extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.375 * sketch_scale: 0.3 * operation: Join with the preceding CAD model(s) This completes the construction of the cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The final shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The rectangular prism has dimensions of length 0.75, width 0.75, and height 0.1875. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.3 and a height of 0.375. The cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom has a diameter of 0.3 and a height of 0.375. The final shape has a slightly tapered top and bottom that joins with the rectangular prism.</description>

Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D prism with the following properties: - Extrude depth toward the normal: 0.1216 - Extrude depth opposite to the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.1216 - Operation: Create a new solid body (NewBodyFeatureOperation) Part 2 Instructions Create a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D cylinder with the following properties: - Extrude depth toward the normal: 0.1622 - Extrude depth opposite to the normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.0473 - Operation: Add material to an existing body (JoinFeatureOperation) For the final shape: - Shape: A cylindrical object with a rectangular base and a tapered top. The object has a flat surface on the top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times the width of the base. The object is centered in the image. - Dimensions: Based on the given data, calculate the height, width, and length of each part and the final shape, but those values are not specified in the provided JSON.</description>

The dimensions of the prism should be 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side should be at a 45 degree angle. The height of the sloped side should be 0.1929 units.</description>
